titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Prasca Arboré and Company records, 1759-1760
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, 2017

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: These documents, written in French, concern the voyage of a French-owned brigantine "Les Bons Amis," which was stopped by both the English and French corsairs as it returned with a cargo of sugar from the West Indies to Cadiz. The papers include a list of the cargo brought from Europe and a report on the voyage written by the captain.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Prasca Arboré and Company records, 1759-1760, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_section.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, January 2017.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: These documents, written in French, concern the voyage of a French-owned brigantine "Les Bons Amis," which was stopped by both the English and French corsairs as it returned with a cargo of sugar from the West Indies to Cadiz. The papers include a list of the cargo brought from Europe and a report on the voyage written by the captain.
